title: Anjarle Beach
subtitle: A Scenic Turtle Nesting Paradise in Konkan
overview: Anjarle Beach is one of the most picturesque and serene beaches on Maharashtra’s Konkan coast, located near Dapoli in Ratnagiri district. Known for its clean white sand, calm waves, and the famous turtle nesting activities, this beach offers a perfect blend of natural beauty and tranquility.

The crescent-shaped shoreline, lined with coconut trees and gentle slopes, makes it an ideal destination for long walks and photography. Overlooking the beach from a nearby hill is the ancient Kadyavarcha Ganpati Temple, adding a spiritual charm to the surroundings.
Anjarle remains one of the least commercialized beaches, preserving its natural ecosystem and providing a quiet escape for nature lovers and families alike.

highlights.title: Turtle Nesting Site
highlights.description: Anjarle is famous for Olive Ridley turtle nesting, especially between December and February.

highlights.title: Crystal-Clear Waters
highlights.description: The beach is known for its pristine sand and shallow waters, ideal for swimming and wading.

highlights.title: Kadyavarcha Ganpati Temple
highlights.description: A revered hilltop temple offering panoramic views of the coastline.

geography.intro: Anjarle Beach lies about 26 km from Dapoli in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra, on the northern Konkan coast. The area is known for its river estuaries, mangroves, and lush coconut groves.

details.label: Landscape
details.value: White sandy shore with river estuary

climate.description: Anjarle experiences a coastal tropical climate with mild winters, hot summers, and humid monsoons.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: November to March
Avoid monsoon (June–September) for safety and better access

geography.conclusion: The pleasant climate and scenic landscapes make Anjarle an ideal destination for eco-tourism and peaceful getaways.

activities.title: Turtle Watching
activities.description: Observe Olive Ridley turtles during the nesting and hatching seasons, organized by local conservation groups.

activities.title: Visit Kadyavarcha Ganpati
activities.description: A 12th-century Ganesh temple located atop a hill offering stunning coastal views.
info: Annual fair in February attracts devotees from across Maharashtra

activities.title: Photography & Nature Walks
activities.description: Capture the beauty of the estuary, mangroves, and pristine shoreline.

activities.title: Boating & Creek Exploration
activities.description: Explore the Anjarle Creek, which meets the sea near the beach — rich in birdlife and scenic beauty.
info: Local fishermen offer short boat rides

attractions.title: Kadyavarcha Ganpati Temple
attractions.description: A historical temple built during the Peshwa period, located on a hilltop overlooking Anjarle Beach.

attractions.title: Anjarle Creek
attractions.description: The confluence of the Jog River with the Arabian Sea creates a scenic estuary with mangroves and birdlife.

attractions.title: Harnai Fort
attractions.description: A coastal fort just 8 km away, known for its maritime history and panoramic sea views.

marineLife.intro: Anjarle Beach supports a rich and diverse marine ecosystem, with turtles, small fish, and coastal vegetation thriving in its calm waters.

items.title: Olive Ridley Turtles
items.description: Anjarle is an important nesting site for these endangered species during winter months.

items.title: Fish & Aquatic Species
items.description: The nearby creek and shallow waters are home to several small fish and crab species.

conclusion: Visitors are encouraged to respect turtle nesting zones and avoid flash photography.
Anjarle’s marine ecosystem remains healthy due to community-driven conservation efforts.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Anjarle is around 26 km from Dapoli and 230 km from Mumbai.
Regular buses and private vehicles are available via Mandangad or Khed routes.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Taxis and state transport buses connect Khed to Anjarle village.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Ratnagiri (130 km) and Pune (200 km).
Cabs or self-drive options available from both cities.

bookingTips.description: Book local homestays or eco-lodges for authentic Konkan hospitality.
Avoid disturbing turtle nesting sites — follow eco-tourism guidelines.
Carry sufficient cash, as ATMs and networks may be limited.
